plugins.name: Juxync
plugins.description:
Want to get alpha access to Jux? Visit jux.io


Jux is a code-based canvas design tool that plugs right into developer's codebase, enabling product designers to design the UI itself and developers its logic.

Creating a good color tokens system is a complex task. Use Juxync to import your variables to Jux to use as design tokens. Juxync will convert your variables collections, groups and modes into token sets to use in Jux. It will maintain all the relationships between variables.


How does Juxync work?

For more visual ‘how does it work‘, visit the knowledge base

  1. It scans Figma color variables in your chosen file.
  2. The plugin auto maps the tokens into core, and other semantics sets.
  3. Sync the tokens into the Jux token management, allowing developers to view and use these tokens via our CLI.


Next up: (or Future features)

  1. Sync Assets (SVG)
  2. Dimensions tokens
  3. Typography styles
  4. Check out the roadmap for more information


Want to be among the first to join the alpha? Join our community

accepted.name: Jux
accepted.description: We’re building a code-based design tool so designers can design the actual, real product as it will be used in production.

plugins.tagline: Juxync imports your Figma Variables as design tokens to Jux, seamlessly.

plugins.name: Swift Layer Exporter
plugins.description:
Manage the layers you want to export based on their name. Just add the file type extension (.jpg, .png, .svg, .pdf) to any layer. With the plugin open select any layer or any parent and all of the tagged layers will automatically be found to export.


You can also set the export scale by adding a percent 200% after the extension. You can also set the layer cropping to its native bounding box with the tag = or to the base frame with #.


  1. button.png # 200% - exports the layer button as a png at 200% in the size of the layout base frame.
  2. button.svg = 100% - exports the layer button as a svg at 100% in the size of the layer.
plugins.tagline: Manage export layers by name

  2. button.svg = 100% - exports the layer button as a svg at 100% in the size of the layer.

plugins.name: Pitchiro
plugins.description:
Ever created a pitch deck that felt sketchy, wasn’t memorable enough, or failed to clearly communicate your project’s core value—so investors turned their backs on you?


Pitchiro lets you generate professional, unique, Y-Combinator-enhanced decks without worrying about them being too generic or inefficient.


Just select the graphics, font, and palette you like, and BOOM... your bulletproof pitch deck is ready!


Plugin features include:

  1. Pitch deck creation
  2. Pre-made deck regeneration


No AI—just flexible templates crafted by professional designers.
plugins.tagline: Pitch Deck Generator — Unique investor-ready deck templates in a minute

plugins.name: FLOWS (alpha)
plugins.description:
FLOWS is an intelligent Figma plugin that brings senior-level UX design critique directly into your workflow. Powered by AI agents from 1000xDesign, we analyze your user interface designs and provide actionable insights to improve user experience, user flow optimization, and design quality.


Key Features

  1. AI-Powered Analysis - Get instant, professional UX critiques from our intelligent design agents
  2. Flow Context Understanding - Automatically extracts and analyzes user context, goals, and flow patterns
  3. Visual Critique Overlay - Generates design critiques directly on your Figma frames
  4. Real-time Feedback - Receive immediate insights without leaving your design environment
  5. Iterative Improvement - Continuous analysis to refine and optimize your design flows


Request Invite code

reach out to alpha_launch@1000x.design
plugins.tagline: Transform your Figma designs with AI-powered UX critique and flow analysis

Generate alt text for images using AI. Improve SEO and accessibility for your websites and rank higher on Google.


Benefits

Automatic: Alt text is automatically added to every image on the site using bulk feature.


Free Credits: Get 5 free credits upon sign up.


Extensive Image Support: Supports the following image types: JPEG, JPG, PNG, GIF, and WEBP.


SEO and Accessibility: Alt text generated is highly optimized to rank higher and improve SEO.


Features

Generate alt text using AI - Use AI to automatically generate alt text for your images.


Bulk generate - Automatically detects all images on site editor and adds alt text.


How It Works

Open plugin.


Get a free API key from https://alttextgeneratorai.com/dashboard


(5 free credits upon sign up)


Start generating alt text for free.


Done!


Credits

The plugin works based on credits. You get 5 free credits upon sign up. If you need to recharge credits, you can visit our pricing page.


Pricing

We don't like monthly plans, so all of our plans are one-time payment plans and affordable to all users.

plugins.name: Text Styles to Variables
plugins.description:
PLUGIN CRAFTED FOR REFOKUS


Plugin Documentation

This plugin extracts font-related properties from your local text styles and converts them into reusable variables. It automatically applies the following variables:

•Font size

•Font weight

•Font family


Additionally, the plugin documents—but does not apply—the following properties:

•Line height

•Letter spacing


This is due to a current Figma limitation: dynamic variables for these properties are not yet supported. As a workaround, these values are stored as string variables for documentation purposes only.


For example:

If the original line-height is 100%, the plugin will store it as a variable with:

variableName: 100%, variableValue: 1em (calculated as 100 ÷ 100 × 1em)


Naming Convention for text styles:


To ensure accurate detection and conversion, your text styles should follow this naming structure:

•Use the prefix title- followed by a number (e.g., title-1) for headings

•Use the prefix text- followed by a number (e.g., text-2) for paragraphs


You can also use suffixes to describe combo classes. For instance:

•text-2-buttonLabel


This will still be recognized as a text-2 style with additional contextual information.
plugins.tagline: By Fede Luna

135683.name: Text Styles to Variables
135683.description:
PLUGIN CRAFTED FOR REFOKUS


Plugin Documentation

This plugin extracts font-related properties from your local text styles and converts them into reusable variables. It automatically applies the following variables:

Additionally, the plugin documents—but does not apply—the following properties:

This is due to a current Figma limitation: dynamic variables for these properties are not yet supported. As a workaround, these values are stored as string variables for documentation purposes only.


For example:

Naming Convention for text styles:

•Use the prefix text- followed by a number (e.g., text-2) for paragraphs


You can also use suffixes to describe combo classes. For instance:

This will still be recognized as a text-2 style with additional contextual information.

plugins.name: dpicon - SVG Icons
plugins.description:
dpicon is a Figma plugin that provides 944 high-quality filled SVG icons for your design projects. Whether you're creating wireframes, prototypes, or polished UI designs, dpicon makes it easy to find and insert the perfect icon. Search for icons by name, double-click to place them on the canvas, or drag and drop for precise placement. With a sleek grid view and real-time search, dpicon streamlines your workflow and boosts productivity.


Key Features:

- 944 filled SVG icons, ready to use.

- Real-time search to quickly find icons.

- Double-click to place icons on the canvas.

- Lightweight and optimized for performance.


Perfect for designers looking to add professional icons to their Figma projects with ease.
plugins.tagline: Icons at Your Fingertips

plugins.name: Structura – Effortless Page Organization
plugins.description:
Effortlessly organize and standardize your Figma files with reusable page templates.


Structura helps teams and designers maintain consistency across projects by enabling the creation, saving, and application of structured page layouts. Whether you prefer using built-in presets or custom templates, Structura simplifies your workflow, ensuring every file is clear and organized.



✨ Key Features


  1. Create & Save Custom Templates – Design your own page structures and reuse them effortlessly.
  2. Use Ready-Made Presets – Get started instantly with professionally designed page layouts.
  3. One-Click Template Application – Quickly apply a structure to any Figma file.
  4. Consistent File Organization – Standardize file layouts for better team collaboration.
  5. Easy Editing & Updating – Modify and update templates as your workflow evolves.



🚀 How to Use


  1. Choose a Template – Select from built-in presets or create your own.
  2. Apply to Your File – Instantly structure your Figma pages with one click.
  3. Customize as Needed – Edit sections or save new layouts for future use.
  4. Stay Organized – Ensure every file follows a consistent and streamlined structure.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly organize and standardize your Figma files with reusable page templates.

plugins.name: Type Rhythm
plugins.description:
A simple plugin for efficiently adjusting typography in Figma. You can increase or decrease font size in 8px increments, and adjust line height in 10% increments. It also allows you to convert Auto line height to 150%. Using tools like Keyboard Maestro to set up shortcuts can enhance your workflow.


Figmaでの文字調整を効率的に行うためのシンプルなプラグインです。フォントサイズを8px単位で増減でき、行間を10%単位で調整可能です。Keyboard Maestroなどのツールを使用してショートカットを設定することで、ワークフローをさらに効率化できます。
plugins.tagline: You can increase or decrease font size in 8px increments.

plugins.name: FontFig
plugins.description:
🤔 How it works:


  1. 1. Choose a font. This will be your base font - it can either be a font you want to manipulate or just help you get a good foundation for the different characters
  2. 2. Import the font. Fontfig will generate an artboard for every character and convert every character into an SVG.
  3. 3. Get creative. Manipulate or create totally new characters.
  4. 4. Export your new font (Whoop)


👉 Pointers:


  1. 📄 One Font can be created / edited per page
  2. 💾 Export each font up to 5 times for one price.
  3. 📐 Adjust the width of the artboard to change letter spacing for each character
  4. 💪 Support for more complex fonts coming soon


💬 We need your feedback:


  1. Drop us a comment or message if you see anything you think could be better. We want to continually improve this Plugin so your feedback is super helpful!
plugins.tagline: Create your own fonts in Figma

plugins.name: bb-extract
plugins.description: With our Figma plugin, easily export design tokens to JSON format and gain the added advantage of live values! The plugin extends the 'import & export variables' example, streamlining the process by excluding imports and introducing a 'calculatedValue' property with actual color values (e.g., #00F instead of {colors.blue}). Now, you can seamlessly integrate design tokens directly into your codebase, making it a breeze to maintain a consistent design system. Simplify your design workflow and boost collaboration with this powerful plugin today!
plugins.tagline: Enhance your design token workflow with live values! 💫

93017.name: bb-extract
93017.description: With our Figma plugin, easily export design tokens to JSON format and gain the added advantage of live values! The plugin extends the 'import & export variables' example, streamlining the process by excluding imports and introducing a 'calculatedValue' property with actual color values (e.g., #00F instead of {colors.blue}). Now, you can seamlessly integrate design tokens directly into your codebase, making it a breeze to maintain a consistent design system. Simplify your design workflow and boost collaboration with this powerful plugin today!
93017.release_notes: Introduced a recursive check for local variables that reference other local variables, ensuring accurate calculation of values. This update resolves issues in previous versions where the target variable was located within a group inside a collection.
93017.tagline: Enhance your design token workflow with live values! 💫

plugins.name: TapTail
plugins.description:
😌 No explicit sign-ups, logins or permissions are required to use TapTail. Just run the plugin!


Have you ever wanted to know if the Figma proto you shared was opened? To see where people clicked? To get insights how your proto works? Read on 👇


Use this example prototype created by Figma to try: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets


TapTail brings real usability data into Figma with minimal effort. Install the plugin, create a prototype sharing link, share the link with your subjects and start collecting metrics. Once you collected enough data (at least one session), you will be able to generate a report directly in your prototype's Figma document (on a separate page).


💬 Feedback and questions (I read and reply to every e-mail): laci@taptail.com

♥️ Found it useful? A 'Like' would mean the world to me! :)


————————


Tired of bouncing between Figma and external usability test tools? With TapTail, you can see metrics directly in Figma:

  1. Session details: Total time spent, time to first click , count of unique sessions and more.
  2. Click positions: Numbered circles on each frame show exactly where and in what order users tapped.
  3. Interaction density: How many taps landed on each screen, helping you spot hot and cold zones.
  4. Labels: Add a tag when copying links to know which channel drove each test.


Your original designs stay untouched: all results are exported on a separate page and overlaid on separate layers of your designs' clones.


————————


🛟 How to use

A very detailed, step-by-step guide on how to create a sharing link and a report:


Creating a sharing link:

  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Click the blue 'Create' button.
  3. Provide a 'Name' and your Figma prototype's sharing URL (simply copy like you normally would and paste it here) then click the blue 'Create' button at the bottom. Once done, it will show you a list with the created item on top.
  4. Click the item's link icon to copy the TapTail sharing link: it will ask if you'd like to track the link (this is optional but recommended: use only numbers and lowercase, english alphabet letters without spaces).
  5. Click the blue 'Copy link [...]' button. Sharing link is now copied on your clipboard.
  6. Share the link with your test subjects. When they open it in their browser, your prototype will appear like the original Figma prototype (as if you would shared from the figma.com link).


Report generation:

  1. Run the plugin in the same Figma document where the shared prototype is located (this is important ❗️).
  2. You can check for new sessions with the 'Refresh' link on the top right corner.
  3. Once you have at least 1 session, you can create a report by pressing the 'Play' button.
  4. A confirmation pop-up will appear first. If you confirm, report generation will start and a loading indicator will appear (normally a report generation takes a few seconds, but could be more depending on your machine's computational capacity and the volume of the collected data).
  5. Report is generated on a new page in the document.


————————


⏳ License & Trial

TapTail is currently in open beta, therefore all features and functions are free for a limited period of time! Feedbacks, questions, bug reports: please and thank you 🤗


————————


🔐 Data handling & privacy

TapTail does NOT need access to your name, e-mail, files, comments, projects, components or styles to work. It only needs a very limited set of data to function:


Your identity

  1. Your Figma user ID is stored, but only in a scrambled form called a hash. A hash is like a one-way fingerprint: can't turn it back into the real ID. Your ID is needed to assign your account the free license.
  2. Other identity related data is only needed if you buy a license, then at least a billing name, billing address and an e-mail address is required.


Your prototype link

Your Figma prototype sharing URL (copied from Figma, provided by you manually) must be stored so your prototype can be served for your users via the TapTail sharing link (which looks like this: https://ux.taptail.com/s/<handle>). Part of the prototype link is a string called the 'file key' (format: https://www.figma.com/proto/<file key>/…) which identifies your Figma document. Since the prototype sharing URL is stored, the file key is also stored (as part of the URL). Read more about the implications here and here.


Prototype emitted events

List of Figma emitted events that are captured (with timestamp + data such as node ID, click and scroll cooridnates, etc. – for more info, click the event name below):

  1. MOUSE_PRESS_OR_RELEASE
  2. PRESENTED_NODE_CHANGED
  3. INITIAL_LOAD
  4. NEW_STATE
  5. REQUEST_CLOSE
  6. LOGIN_SCREEN_SHOWN
  7. PASSWORD_SCREEN_SHOWN


This data is only used to build your in-Figma reports and are never shared with anyone else.

You can learn more about embeds in general here: Embed Figma Files.


————————


🚧 Roadmap & new features

In no particular order, directly from my todo list:

  1. define expiration date+time;
  2. define simple instructions/ welcome screen;
  3. designated success screen (to enable missions);
  4. component variant change handling;
  5. data export in structured form (like JSON, CSV, …);
  6. <your ideas maybe? get in touch!>


————————


🪳 Found a bug? Got feedback? Have an idea for a feature?

E-mail me at laci@taptail.com!

I read and reply to every e-mail :)


————————


🫶 Credits

  1. The prototype used for demo in the video: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets
plugins.tagline: Prototype usability analytics right inside Figma

136499.name: TapTail
136499.description:
😌 No explicit sign-ups, logins or permissions are required to use TapTail. Just run the plugin!


Have you ever wanted to know if the Figma proto you shared was opened? To see where people clicked? To get insights how your proto works? Read on 👇


Use this example prototype created by Figma to try: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets


TapTail brings real usability data into Figma with minimal effort. Install the plugin, create a prototype sharing link, share the link with your subjects and start collecting metrics. Once you collected enough data (at least one session), you will be able to generate a report directly in your prototype's Figma document (on a separate page).


💬 Feedback and questions (I read and reply to every e-mail): laci@taptail.com

♥️ Found it useful? A 'Like' would mean the world to me! :)


————————


Tired of bouncing between Figma and external usability test tools? With TapTail, you can see metrics directly in Figma:

  1. Session details: Total time spent, time to first click , count of unique sessions and more.
  2. Click positions: Numbered circles on each frame show exactly where and in what order users tapped.
  3. Interaction density: How many taps landed on each screen, helping you spot hot and cold zones.
  4. Labels: Add a tag when copying links to know which channel drove each test.


Your original designs stay untouched: all results are exported on a separate page and overlaid on separate layers of your designs' clones.


————————


🛟 How to use

A very detailed, step-by-step guide on how to create a sharing link and a report:


Creating a sharing link:

  1. Run the plugin.
  2. Click the blue 'Create' button.
  3. Provide a 'Name' and your Figma prototype's sharing URL (simply copy like you normally would and paste it here) then click the blue 'Create' button at the bottom. Once done, it will show you a list with the created item on top.
  4. Click the item's link icon to copy the TapTail sharing link: it will ask if you'd like to track the link (this is optional but recommended: use only numbers and lowercase, english alphabet letters without spaces).
  5. Click the blue 'Copy link [...]' button. Sharing link is now copied on your clipboard.
  6. Share the link with your test subjects. When they open it in their browser, your prototype will appear like the original Figma prototype (as if you would shared from the figma.com link).


Report generation:

  1. Run the plugin in the same Figma document where the shared prototype is located (this is important ❗️).
  2. You can check for new sessions with the 'Refresh' link on the top right corner.
  3. Once you have at least 1 session, you can create a report by pressing the 'Play' button.
  4. A confirmation pop-up will appear first. If you confirm, report generation will start and a loading indicator will appear (normally a report generation takes a few seconds, but could be more depending on your machine's computational capacity and the volume of the collected data).
  5. Report is generated on a new page in the document.


————————


⏳ License & Trial

TapTail is currently in open beta, therefore all features and functions are free for a limited period of time! Feedbacks, questions, bug reports: please and thank you 🤗


————————


🔐 Data handling & privacy

TapTail does NOT need access to your name, e-mail, files, comments, projects, components or styles to work. It only needs a very limited set of data to function:


Your identity

  1. Your Figma user ID is stored, but only in a scrambled form called a hash. A hash is like a one-way fingerprint: can't turn it back into the real ID. Your ID is needed to assign your account the free license.
  2. Other identity related data is only needed if you buy a license, then at least a billing name, billing address and an e-mail address is required.


Your prototype link

Your Figma prototype sharing URL (copied from Figma, provided by you manually) must be stored so your prototype can be served for your users via the TapTail sharing link (which looks like this: https://ux.taptail.com/s/<handle>). Part of the prototype link is a string called the 'file key' (format: https://www.figma.com/proto/<file key>/…) which identifies your Figma document. Since the prototype sharing URL is stored, the file key is also stored (as part of the URL). Read more about the implications here and here.


Prototype emitted events

List of Figma emitted events that are captured (with timestamp + data such as node ID, click and scroll cooridnates, etc. – for more info, click the event name below):

  1. MOUSE_PRESS_OR_RELEASE
  2. PRESENTED_NODE_CHANGED
  3. INITIAL_LOAD
  4. NEW_STATE
  5. REQUEST_CLOSE
  6. LOGIN_SCREEN_SHOWN
  7. PASSWORD_SCREEN_SHOWN


This data is only used to build your in-Figma reports and are never shared with anyone else.

You can learn more about embeds in general here: Embed Figma Files.


————————


🚧 Roadmap & new features

In no particular order, directly from my todo list:

  1. define expiration date+time;
  2. define simple instructions/ welcome screen;
  3. designated success screen (to enable missions);
  4. component variant change handling;
  5. data export in structured form (like JSON, CSV, …);
  6. <your ideas maybe? get in touch!>


————————


🪳 Found a bug? Got feedback? Have an idea for a feature?

E-mail me at laci@taptail.com!

I read and reply to every e-mail :)


————————

  1. The prototype used for demo in the video: https://www.figma.com/community/file/915647337333327091/figma-for-beginners-2020-petma-the-social-media-app-for-pets

plugins.name: Varcator - Figma Variable Usage Finder
plugins.description:
Varcator - Figma Variable Usage Finder For Dev Mode


Varcator is a Figma plugin that helps you find where text variables are being used in your design files. It provides an efficient way to scan and track variable usage across your Figma projects.


🔥 Highly Recommend to select one variable at a time. 🔥


Features


  1. Variable Collection Scanning: Scan all text variables in your Figma file
  2. Selective Scanning: Choose which variables to scan for usage
  3. Usage Tracking: Find where each variable is being used
  4. Interactive UI: Click on usages to navigate to the specific layers
  5. Efficient Processing: Optimized scanning with rate limiting to prevent API throttling
  6. User-Friendly Interface: Clean and intuitive design for easy variable management
plugins.tagline: Figma Variable Usage Finder for Dev Mode

133934.name: Varcator - Figma Variable Usage Finder
133934.description:

plugins.name: Freaking Fake Data
plugins.description:
About plugin:

Freaking Fake Data simplifies your design workflow in Figma, FigJam and Slides by letting you fill mockups with custom, project-specific data instead of random content. Take control of your text layers, create tailored datasets and unify data formats for your design team — perfect for consistent names, phone numbers or other details. Working locally, it boosts productivity and eliminates errors while speeding up mockup creation.


Key Features:

  1. Effortless Mockup Filling: Quickly populate text layers with your data.
  2. Unified Team Data: Import a CSV or JSON file for team consistency.
  3. Bulk Text Magic: Mass-apply text to layers with one click.
  4. Cross-Platform Support: Works in Figma, FigJam and Slides.
  5. Easy Data Import: Upload CSV or JSON files instantly.
  6. Default Data Option: Test with preloaded samples (e.g., names, cities).


How to Use:

  1. Import Data: Create a table in a tool like Google Sheets or Excel, fill it with data, export as CSV or JSON, and upload—or use default data. Import multiple files and switch via tabs.
  2. Select Text Layers: Highlight the text layers to apply data to.
  3. Apply Data: Pick a column (e.g., "First Name") and apply data. Choose order:
  4. Sort: Inserts data in table order.
  5. Random: Inserts data in random order.
  6. Explore Options: Switch tabs, view rows, or use "Set as Default" to save a tab for next launch.


How to Create a Table:

  1. Enter data in columns (e.g., "First Name" in one, "City" in another); the first row becomes button names.
  2. Add separators by leaving a column empty with "---" or "- - -" in the header for a line or use "//Special Offers" or "// Special Offers" for a labeled group divider. (example: telegram)


Perfect for prototypes, presentations or team projects — try it now!
plugins.tagline: Fill Mockups Quickly — use unified data for your design team. Massively paste your text into Figma

plugins.name: PRE: AI Design Review
plugins.description:
PRE helps designers and product teams understand how users will interact with their UI designs — before a single line of code is written.


🔹 Select any frame in Figma and click “Upload Selected Frame” to send it to PRE.

🔹 PRE will automatically generate a heatmap, predict click-through rates, and provide UX suggestions using AI.

🔹 You can modify the generated tags, draw additional clickable elements, or toggle the heatmap overlay on and off using the second button in the top bar.

🔹 Once you're happy with the predictions, you can download the heatmap and click data for further analysis or presentation.


Whether you're working on early wireframes or high-fidelity mocks, PRE helps you make design decisions backed by predictive user analytics — all from right inside Figma.


Powered by PRE
plugins.tagline: Export any Figma frame and instantly generate heatmaps, CTR predictions and UX feedback with PRE.

133946.name: PRE: AI Design Review
133946.description:
PRE helps designers and product teams understand how users will interact with their UI designs — before a single line of code is written.

🔹 You can modify the generated tags, draw additional clickable elements, or toggle the heatmap overlay on and off using the second button in the top bar.

🔹 Once you're happy with the predictions, you can download the heatmap and click data for further analysis or presentation.


Whether you're working on early wireframes or high-fidelity mocks, PRE helps you make design decisions backed by predictive user analytics — all from right inside Figma.


Powered by PRE
133946.release_notes:
New modern UI with streamlined upload flow.
Integration with PRE 2.5.
Enhanced Design Review feedback section.
Improved support messaging for invalid selections.
133946.tagline: Export any Figma frame and instantly generate heatmaps, CTR predictions and UX feedback with PRE.

plugins.name: Sliding Text
plugins.description:
Sliding Text transforms static text into engaging animated components with just a few clicks. This plugin allows designers to:


  1. Convert any text layer into a dynamic text slide component
  2. Customize animation direction (top-to-bottom, bottom-to-top, left-to-right, right-to-left)
  3. Fine-tune animation timing, stagger delay, and easing
  4. Preview animations directly in the plugin interface
  5. Create components that maintain the original text's font, size, and styling
  6. Generate a "done" state for the final animation frame


Simply select a text layer, enter your phrases or words separated by commas, choose your animation settings, and let the plugin generate a fully configured component with smart animate transitions. Perfect for creating engaging sliding text / rotating messages / dynamic text effects without any coding knowledge.
plugins.tagline: Smooth text slide animations with customizable directions and timing

129512.description:

  4. Preview animations directly in the plugin interface
  5. Create components that maintain the original text's font, size, and styling
  6. Generate a "done" state for the final animation frame


Simply select a text layer, enter your phrases or words separated by commas, choose your animation settings, and let the plugin generate a fully configured component with smart animate transitions. plugins.name: Fillio - Elevate design with dynamic content
plugins.description:
Fillio - Less Typing, More Designing


Fillio is the simplest way to populate your Figma designs with realistic {{placeholder}} content. Whether you’re working on wireframes, prototypes, invoices, brand books, or daily UI design, Fillio saves you time by instantly filling your artboards with dynamic content.



Key Features:


Quick & Easy Filling:

Fill your designs with placeholders like names, addresses, and all type of contents in a single click.


Customizable Placeholders:

Use simple tags like {{name}} or {{Date}} to create dynamic content that fits your design.


Efficient Workflow:

Skip the tedious task of manually adding content—let Fillio do the heavy lifting.


Perfect for Prototypes & Wireframes:

Make your designs look polished even in early stages, without all the manual effort.



How it Works:


  1. Install Fillio from the Figma Community.
  2. Select the elements or frames where you want to add placeholders.
  3. Define Your Placeholders using simple tags like {{name}} or {{Type}}.
  4. Click “Submit”, and Fillio automatically adds content to your design.



Get Started with Fillio Today!

accepted.name: Mohammed M.Akasha
accepted.description: A User-centered Designer who crafts meaningful products through design.

plugins.tagline: Less Filling.. More designing.

plugins.name: Link Spacing & Radius Variables (Alpha)
plugins.description:
One-click application of variables to selected objects


Important: Variable Requirements

1. Variables must be in an external library (local variables are not supported yet)

2. The library must be connected to your file


Variable Naming Requirements:

For Spacing:

- Format: `space-{number}`

- Examples: `space-4`, `space-8`, `space-16`, `space-24`

- Variable value must match the number in the name

For Radius:

- Format: `radius-{number}`

- Examples: `radius-4`, `radius-8`, `radius-16`

- Variable value must match the number in the name


Collection Requirements:

- Spacing collection must include the word "spacing" in its name

- Radius collection must include the word "radius" or "border-radius" in its name


How to Prepare Your File

1. Connect the variable library:

- Open "Team Library" menu

- Find the required library

- Enable the toggle next to the "Variables" section

2. Ensure objects are prepared:

- For spacing: objects must use Auto Layout

- For radius: objects must support the cornerRadius property


How to Use

1. Select objects you want to apply variables to

2. Launch the plugin

3. Choose the desired collection from the dropdown (marked with 📚 icon)

4. Click "Apply spacing" or "Apply radius"
plugins.tagline: Link spacing and radius variables

plugins.name: Lexi: Localize & Translate your design
plugins.description:
Design once—translate instantly. Lexi automates text translation in your Figma frames while keeping your layout intact. Perfect for multilingual apps, marketing assets, and App/Play Store screenshots.


🚀 Why Lexi?

50+ languages – Translate your designs into multiple languages in seconds.

Batch translation – Select multiple frames & languages at once.

Seamless workflow – Translated frames stay organized with clear naming.



🔧 How It Works

Select your frames – Pick the designs you need to translate.

Choose your languages – Supports all major languages, including English, Spanish, Japanese, Arabic, and more.

Translate with AI – Lexi uses OpenAI’s GPT-3.5 Turbo for high-quality, natural translations.

Get organized output – New frames are created, named with language codes, and maintain the original design structure.


🔒 Best Practices

Font compatibility – If a language isn't displaying correctly, try swapping fonts to Roboto or Inter for best results.


Who is Lexi for?

🌎 Designers working on global products.

📱 Teams creating multi-language UI/UX designs.

📢 Marketers adapting assets for international campaigns.

🏢 Agencies handling multilingual clients.


Credits:

Some of the designs featured in this plugin are from @ramsriperambudr. Thanks for the amazing work! 🙌


Ready to make your designs multilingual? Start localizing with Lexi today! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Translate all text in selected frames—perfect for multilingual apps & App/Play Store assets.

plugins.name: BANCONE
plugins.description: BANCONE is a Software-as-a-Service platform powered by an integrated suite of AI-driven tools that simplify, optimize, and improve the quality of Human-Machine Interaction (HMI) design and development. Initially focused on the automotive sector, specifically software-defined vehicles, the platform is designed to expand to other industrial domains in the future. BANCONE transforms how automotive teams create and implement sophisticated cockpit interfaces, leveraging artificial intelligence to automate routine tasks, detect issues early, and generate innovative design solutions.
plugins.tagline: BANCONE is a Software-as-a-Service platform powered by an integrated suite of AI-driven tools

- Add orientation switch 
- Remove side groups (_left and _right)
- Change modular color
- Add tooltips
136875.tagline: create aisles to facilitate geolocation, making it easier to organize and structure spatial layouts

plugins.name: ColorFinder

Specify a color code and search for the location to be used in the screen.

This is useful when the number of colors has increased and you are not sure where they are used!

plugins.name: Design Notes
plugins.description:
不用创建组件，快速保存和复用设计资源。

你可以

  1. 保存最近常用的图标、组件、图片等所有设计
  2. 快速创建克隆
  3. 在单独的页面快速备份设计稿，保持页面整洁
  4. 当作有历史记录的剪贴板使用

---

注意：

  1. 本插件仅记录元素的id信息用于检索，不存储实际设计内容
  2. 本地存储，不支持跨设备跨浏览器
  3. 不支持跨文件调用设计内容

---

Quickly save and reuse design resources without creating components.


You can:

  1. Save frequently used icons, components, images, and all design elements.
  2. Quickly create clones.
  3. Backup design drafts on a separate page to keep your workspace organized.
  4. Use it as a clipboard with history.


Note:

  1. This plugin only records the ID information of elements for retrieval and does not store actual design content.
  2. It uses local storage and does not support cross-device or cross-browser functionality.
  3. It also does not support calling design content across different files.

---

contact: Tylergg98@outlook.com
plugins.tagline: Simpy save and re-use your designs without managing components

plugins.name: One Click Export
plugins.description:
📌 ストーリー

フレームを指定してエクスポートをするときに、意図しない下の階層でエクスポートがされて悲しんでいる方々をたくさん見てきました。

そこで！少しでも役に立てればと思いプラグインを作っちゃいました！


このプラグインなら、セクションをクリックするだけで、その直下にあるフレームをボタンひとつで "カンタン" にエクスポートできちゃいます。

これで間違った階層でのエクスポートミスも防げるようになりました！

やったね🙌


📝 使い方

  1. プラグインを起動する
  2. セクションをクリックする
  3. セクション上にあるフレームがリストで表示されるので、順番にエクスポートのボタンをクリックする


⭐️ 今後のアップデート予定

  1. イケてるUIにする
  2. セクション上にあるフレームをまとめてエクスポートできるようにする
plugins.tagline: セクション直下にあるフレームをカンタンにエクスポートできる

plugins.name: Paint swatch
plugins.description:
Enter the name of the paint color you want to swatch, and it'll make a rectangle of your chosen color with with a name that links to the color's page its respective website.


Supported libraries:

  1. Farrow and Ball
  2. Little Greene
  3. Paint & Paper Library
  4. Edward Bulmer

plugins.name: Node Vars
plugins.description: This plugin tracks what nodes you have selected (and their children!) and shows you all of the bound variables that are referenced in a table. You can then copy each individually or all bound variables for a node in a CSS format.
plugins.tagline: See what variables your selected nodes are using

84177.description: This plugin tracks what nodes you have selected (and their children!) and shows you all of the bound variables that are referenced in a table. You can then copy each individually or all bound variables for a node in a CSS format.

plugins.name: Style Base
plugins.description:
Stylebase – The Ultimate Design Token Generator for Figma


Stylebase is your all-in-one Figma plugin to supercharge your design workflow. Instantly generate and customize color styles, typography styles, shadow styles, grid systems, and spacing tokens — all from one powerful tool. Whether you're designing a new UI kit or refining an existing design system, Stylebase helps you stay consistent and efficient.


With just one click, you can:

  1. Create all design styles for your project
  2. Generate a fully documented style guide for easy handoff and team alignment


Built for designers, by designers — Stylebase gives you full control and flexibility with customizable presets, responsive token scaling, and seamless integration into any design system.


🎨 Say goodbye to manual setup.

⚡ Say hello to pixel-perfect consistency.


Perfect for: UX/UI Designers, Design System Creators, Product Teams, and Freelancers.

accepted.name: Siddhant giri
accepted.description: Product Designer and a Frontend Developer from India.

plugins.tagline: Style & Document your Design System Faster!

Whether you're designing a new UI kit or refining an existing design system, Stylebase helps you stay consistent and efficient.

  1. Create all design styles for your project

Built for designers, by designers — Stylebase gives you full control and flexibility with customizable presets, responsive token scaling, and seamless integration into any design system.

132682.tagline: Style & Document your Design System Faster!

plugins.name: Figma Variables → CSV Export
plugins.description: Export every local variable in your Figma file to a clean CSV with one click. No OAuth, no servers—just download and drop it into Google Sheets.
plugins.tagline: Instantly dump your Figma variables to CSV—zero servers, zero hassle.

132822.name: Figma Variables → CSV Export
132822.description: Export every local variable in your Figma file to a clean CSV with one click. No OAuth, no servers—just download and drop it into Google Sheets.
132822.tagline: Instantly dump your Figma variables to CSV—zero servers, zero hassle.

plugins.name: Paste Data
plugins.description:
🧩 Paste CSV into Text Layers

Paste tabular data directly into selected Figma text layers. Supports Excel or CSV data, auto-detects rows or columns, and applies values instantly.


🧠 Smart paste detection: one row = horizontal; multiple rows = vertical

💡 Works with grouped/frames/nested selections

⚡ Designed for quick content updates and data-driven designs
plugins.tagline: Paste Multiple Rows and Columns of Data into Table Cells

131749.name: Paste Data
131749.description:
🧩 Paste CSV into Text Layers

Paste tabular data directly into selected Figma text layers. Supports Excel or CSV data, auto-detects rows or columns, and applies values instantly.


🧠 Smart paste detection: one row = horizontal; multiple rows = vertical

💡 Works with grouped/frames/nested selections

⚡ Designed for quick content updates and data-driven designs
131749.tagline: Paste Multiple Rows and Columns of Data into Table Cells
